metadata.title: CVE-2019-9511 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to window size manipulation andstream prioritization manipulation, potentially leading to a denial ofservice. The attacker requests a large amount of data from a specifiedresource over multiple streams. They manipulate window size and streampriority to force the server to queue the data in 1-byte chunks. Dependingon how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU,memory, or both.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9511` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnginx-mod-http-auth-pam - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-cache-purge - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-dav-ext - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-echo - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-fancyindex - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-geoip - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-headers-more-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-image-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-lua - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-ndk - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-perl - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-subs-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-uploadprogress - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-upstream-fair - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-http-xslt-filter - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-mail - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-nchan - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-rtmp - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
libnginx-mod-stream - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx-common - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx-core - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx-extras - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx-full - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
nginx-light - 1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.0-0ubuntu1.4').
nghttp2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
